oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Potato late blight - fatal threat in organic potato production
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Hannukkala, Asko
Lehtinen, Ari
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Crop health, quality, protection
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Improved potato late blight management is crucial for the continuity of organic potato production. Two major changes in cultural practises are necessary: more diverse crop rotation with at least 4 years between consecutive potato crops and optimising nitrogen fertilisation according to the needs of the crop.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Hannukkala, Asko and Lehtinen, Ari (2005) Potato late blight - fatal threat in organic potato production. Forskningsnytt om Ã¸kologisk landbruk i Norden (1), pp. 10-11.
